refnamediv.refpurpose: Deletes documents from the runtime cache

refsection.title: Introduction
refsection.para: XML Calabash maintains a cache of documents. This step deletes a document from the cache.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: XML Calabash maintains a cache of documents, see cx:cache-add for a description of how this works. A pipeline can delete a document from the cache explicitly with cx:cache-delete. If the href option is provided, it is used as the URI for caching, otherwise the source document URI is used. It is a dynamic error if the source document does not have a base URI and the href option is not provided.

Irrespective of the cache URI, the step simply copies its source document to the result port. (It does not change the documentâ€™s base URI, even if an href option is provided to the cx:cache-delete step.)

para.error: It is a dynamic error if the fail-if-not-in-cache option is true and the cache does not contains a document with the URI being cached.

refsection.para: The cx:cache-delete step will only delete documents that match that content type. (Wildcards may be used for the media type and subtype).

listitem.para: The URI to cache. Defaults to the source document URI.
Determines whether the URI must already exist in the cache.
Determines which content-type hits in the cache will be deleted.
